TF028194-DEET-LABOR MARKET CONSULTANCY

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Protection Project's
            outcome is rated as unsatisfactory, sustainability as
            likely, institutional development impact as negligible, Bank
            performance as satisfactory, and borrower performance as
            unsatisfactory. In late 1998, the Republic introduced
            drastic policy changes regarding social protection and
            employment services which completely undermined the
            rationale for the project. The 1998 Russian financial crisis
            and diminishing oil revenue were important in motivating the
            government's 1998 policy changes and affected the
            implementation of the project. The key lessons learned
            include: An investment project not linked to a policy-based
            loan has little ability to influence policy. By mid-1999, it
            was evident that the priorities of the government had
            changed and no longer included the goals for which the
            project had been established. Where appropriate, the Bank
            should give greater consideration to project closure.
            Building capacity among regional and local officials at the
            point of service delivery can yield large benefits.
